page.title: 04FARMING 2
page.content: Farming is very important in this region. The main crops are wheat, sugar beet and oil seed rape. In Moulton carrots are grown for the local packing station. Some of the fields are used for growing grass for sheep and cows. Those are the most common animals but there are a few pigs which are reared for bacon. There are not very many horses that pull ploughs but there are lots of race horses on studs. The fields are mostly large but they do have some small fields for grazing the horses. Just outside Moulton there is a small field of potatoes where the land is lighter and easier to plough.
